abort verb
(STOP)
[ I or T ] to cause something to stop or fail before it begins or before it is complete: The mission had to be aborted at the last minute. If something goes wrong during the launch sequence the system will automatically abort.
More examplesFewer examplesThe pilot missed the approach and aborted the landing.The coup was aborted.If the time limit is passed the connection will abort.

abort verb
(END PREGNANCY)
[ I or T ] to stop the development of a baby that has not been born, usually by having a medical operation: He declared that women have a right to abort a nonviable fetus. The decision to abort may be based on many factors.
[ I ] to have a miscarriage (= an early, unintentional end to a pregnancy): The bacterial infection can cause animals to abort.
More examplesFewer examplesThe procedure may be done to abort a pregnancy.The choice to abort is often complex.As a result of the contamination mothers were aborting, or giving birth to stillborn or deformed babies.
